oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Post Office, Custom and Federal Building
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: “Post Office, Custom and Federal Building, Memphis, Tenn.” Color image.

“This new building, completed in 1931 at a cost of $1,000,000, houses the Central Post Office, Customs Offices, District U. S. Court and other Governmental offices. Memphis, on the east bank of the Mississippi, is the greatest inland cotton market in the world, and the financial and commercial capital of the lower Mississippi Valley. [Typed/Pre-printed] Mrs. P. C. Tucker -- 1224 Poplar St. -- Pine Bluff, -- Ark. -- Appreciated your -- letters. Will be home -- 7 or 8 P.M. Sat. Map. -- train. Love to all -- Mary -- Call if you want -- anything tomorrow [Handwritten]”
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Customs House; courthouses; Shelby County Courthouse; post office; downtown; law; government; buildings;
